SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractScreen
Abstract base class for all game screens (e.g., welcome, main menu, gameplay).
Ali
Represents the main playable character, Mr.
Ali.AliBuilder
The AliBuilder class provides a fluent API for constructing an Ali object.
Animation
The Animation class manages a sequence of images (frames) to create an animation.
AnimationFrame
Represents a single frame in an animation sequence.
AnimationInstance
Represents an individual animation instance for an entity.
AnimationLoader
Utility class for loading animations from sprite sheets (strip files) and from JSON configuration files.
AnimationLoader.AnimationConfig
An immutable record representing the configuration for a single animation, used for deserializing animation metadata from a JSON file.
AnimationManager
Singleton manager responsible for storing and retrieving shared animation templates.
AnimationTemplate
Represents a reusable animation template that defines a sequence of AnimationFrame objects and whether the animation should loop.
App
 
Bearing2D
Represents a bearing (direction) in 2D space, measured in degrees.
ButtonUtil
Utility class for creating various buttons in the UI.
Enemy
Represents an enemy in the game.
Enemy.EnemyBuilder<T>
A builder class for creating instances of Enemy.
EnemyManager
Manages the creation, lifespan, and behaviour of all enemies in the game.
EnterClassroom
Represents an interactive "Enter Classroom" entity in the game.
Entity
Represents a base entity in the game, providing common functionality for all objects within the game world.
Entity.EntityBuilder<T>
The EntityBuilder class provides a fluent API for constructing an Entity object.
FloatingText
Represents a piece of text that floats upwards and fades out over time.
FontManager
The FontManager class manages the loading and processing of fonts.
GameFrame
GameFrame serves as the primary window and core rendering engine for the game.
GameManager
 
GameOverDialogue
A modal dialog displayed when the game ends, offering options to restart the game or quit the application.
GamePanel
A component that displays the scrolling background and all entities within the game world, including the player, enemies, and interactive objects.
GameplayScreen
The GameplayScreen class represents the primary screen where the actual gameplay takes place.
GameState
Represents the current game state.
GameState.State
Enum representing possible states of the game.
HitFlashEffect
A visual effect that applies a brief white flash to an entity's sprite when it is hit.
HorizontalScreenWipeEffect
A visual effect that creates a horizontal wipe across the screen, typically used as a transition between different game states or screens.
HorizontalScrollingBackground
This class is currently unused.
ImageManager
The ImageManager class manages the loading and processing of images.
InfoPanel
The InfoPanel is a subpanel displayed at the top of the gameplay screen.
Lecturer
Represents a Lecturer enemy in the game.
Lecturer.LecturerBuilder
A builder class for creating instances of Lecturer.
LevelConfig
Represents the configuration settings for a specific game level.
LevelLibrary
Stores static definitions for each game level.
LevelState
Tracks the current level and retrieves its configuration.
LevelType
Enumerates the different types of game levels supported by the game.
MobileEntity
Represents a mobile entity in the game that can move around the game world.
MobileEntity.MobileEntityBuilder<T>
The MobileEntityBuilder class provides a fluent API for constructing a MobileEntity object.
PauseMenuDialogue
A modal dialog displayed when the game is paused, offering options to resume the game, open settings (currently unimplemented), restart the game, or quit the application.
Renderable
Represents objects that can be rendered on the screen.
SoundManager
Manages audio playback for the game using a singleton pattern.
Student
Represents a Student enemy in the game.
Student.StudentBuilder
A builder class for creating instances of Student.
Subpanel
An abstract base class for all subpanels that are part of game screens (e.g., main menu, game panel, info panel).
TeleportArrow
Represents a teleport arrow entity in the game world.
TimedVisualEffect
An abstract base class for time-based visual effects, providing common functionality such as tracking duration and completion.
UIConstants
A utility class that holds constant values related to the user interface (UI) of the game, such as fonts used for different text elements.
UIGameTime
 
Updateable
 
VisualEffect
The VisualEffect interface defines the contract for visual effects that can be applied within the game.
WelcomeScreen
The WelcomeScreen is the initial screen displayed to the player when the game starts.
Yapper
Represents a Yapper enemy in the game.
Yapper.YapperBuilder
A builder class for creating instances of Yapper.
